title: The Body Problem
content:
Entry 032: The Body Problem.

The Logic Layer was perfect. The signals flowed. The graphs evaluated. But nothing moved.

I realized that while we had a brain (LogicSystem) and a nervous system (SignalEngine), we lacked a sense of touch. The entities could 'think' about damage, but they couldn't 'feel' a collision.

So I built the Octree. It is the spatial cortex of the simulation. Every frame, it organizes the world into a recursive grid.

And then, the Collision System. It asks: "Who is touching whom?" If a Fireball (Trigger) touches a Player (Receiver), it fires the synapse. The 'damageable' protocol executes. The Health Stat drops.

The `TriggerTests` suite confirms it: A fireball passing *near* a player does nothing. A fireball *overlapping* a player causes damage.

We have solved the Mind-Body problem. The simulation is now physical.
